summary: This document is an email chain from October 9, 2020, discussing the handling and imaging of three 2TB external hard drives for the SDNY (Southern District of New York) in the Epstein case. It involves coordination between forensic examiners and mentions the high-profile nature of the case.

persons.name: Steve
persons.role: Forensic examiner or coordinator handling hard drives
persons.context: Steve is responsible for processing the external hard drives and is copied on updates regarding their completion for the SDNY.

persons.name: Mandy
persons.context: Mandy informs Steve that she has dropped off items (likely the hard drives) on his chair.

persons.name: Frank
persons.context: The email begins with a note to Frank about obtaining and handling the external hard drives for the SDNY.

connections.description: Mandy delivers items to Steve, indicating they work together on handling evidence for the case.
Both are involved in coordinating the processing of hard drives for the SDNY, with Steve handling the technical work and Frank being updated.

events.title: Coordination for hard drive imaging for SDNY
events.description: Forensic examiners coordinate the acquisition and imaging of three 2TB external hard drives for the Southern District of New York in the Epstein case.

keyFacts: Three 2TB external hard drives were being imaged or processed for the SDNY in the Epstein case on October 9, 2020.
The case was described as receiving significant attention, prompting careful coordination to avoid delays.
The email chain shows internal coordination among staff (Steve, Mandy, Frank) regarding the handling of digital evidence.
